keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein signed a new will and placed his assets into 'The 1953 Trust' on August 8, 2019, just two days before his death.
Epstein's estate was valued at $577,672,654, which was approximately $18 million more than he had stated in prior bail proceedings.
The will names longtime employees Darren Indyke (lawyer) and Richard Kahn (businessman) as executors, with Boris Nikolic as an alternate.
Epstein's only potential heir was his brother, Mark Epstein, but the will supersedes any claim he might have had.
The document lists Epstein's major properties, including islands in the U.S. Virgin Islands and homes in Manhattan, New Mexico, Florida, and Paris.
